snippet: Female victims of violence in Afghanistan are often afraid to report abuses to government authorities and rarely see their cases taken to trial, according to a United Nations report.
abstract: United Nations study of Afghanistan's Elimination of Violence Against Women Act, enacted in 2009 to give recourse to victims of violence, finds that use of law has increased significantly but still lags behind number of complaints and that only small percentage of incidents are registered with police or courts.
lead_paragraph: Female victims of violence in Afghanistan are often afraid to report abuses to government authorities and rarely see their cases taken to trial, according to a United Nations report.

headline.seo: Afghan Law Offering Abused Women Redress Makes Slow Gains
headline.main: Slow Gains in Justice for Afghan Women
headline.print_headline: Slow Gains in Justice for Afghan Women

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
